timeline.bodyText:
I was wondering for some time, which of Class.getCanonicalName() and Class.getName() is better to use here and I recently found that it is very easy to figure out: The ReflectiveClassBuildItem has constructor variants accepting java.lang.Class-es in addition to the ones accepting string class names. Internally, the Class values are transformed to strings and ta-daa ...
... the method used is Class.getName() https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/1.3.1.Final/core/deployment/src/main/java/io/quarkus/deployment/builditem/nativeimage/ReflectiveClassBuildItem.java#L38
This is just an interesting detail I wanted to share. It does not matter for non-inner classes.
timeline.author: ppalaga

replies.bodyText: I believe we can do some cleanup in all the aws extensions in subsequent PRs, no problem for me :-)
replies.author: oscerd
